title: cmd/5g: passing -P to 5g causes a fault
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?

panda(~/src) % cat hello.go 
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
        fmt.Println("Hello ARM")
}
panda(~/src) % go build -gcflags -P hello.go
# command-line-arguments
copy R1->R0 f=0
0042 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    $"".autotmp_0001+0(SP),R1; R1set and
!f; f=1
0043 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    R1,R1
0044 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    1(R1),R1
0045 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) ADD     $1,R1
0046 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    R1,R1
0047 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW.P  1(R0),R2; R0rar; return 0
gotit: R1->R0
0039 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    $1(R0),R0
0040 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) NOP     ,
0041 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    R0,R1 last
copy R0->R1 f=0
0042 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:6) MOVW    $"".autotmp_0001+0(SP),R1; R1set;
return 1
shortprop
0000 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:7) MOVBU   "".initdoneÂ·+0(SB),R2
0067 (/home/dfc/src/hello.go:7) MOVBU   R2,R0/home/dfc/src/hello.go:7: internal compiler
error: fault

Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

panda(~/src) % uname -a
Linux panda 3.7.10-x13 #1 SMP Wed Jun 26 07:33:15 UTC 2013 armv7l GNU/Linux
panda(~/src) % go version
go version devel +eeb3547ccd1b Tue Feb 04 11:53:13 2014 -0800 linux/arm
